intro: Dalechampia roezliana var. alba, commonly known as white dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with characteristic latex-producing structures. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
